title: Strategies for Enhancing Accountability through Video Utilization and Quiz-based Online Mathematics Learning: Scientific Inquiry and Application of Equation, Graph, and Statistical Concepts

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of fundamental math concepts (operations, basic equations, simple graphs) and experience with online learning platforms, understanding of basic statistical terminology (variables, measurement, analysis)
context.additional_context: Blended learning environment for professionals in medical/legal/technical fields, with digital devices provided and project-based assessments (data analysis reports, case-specific mathematical modeling). Learners are evaluated on decision-making skills using mathematical evidence in real work contexts.

learning_goals: Learners complete at least 80% of a 6-minute video lecture and visually/analytically understand the process of solving linear equations and data visualization.
Learners pass video-based quizzes with an average accuracy of 90% or higher and solve problems involving probability distribution calculations and statistical inference.

Learners apply mathematical concepts (linear equations, data visualization, inferential problem-solving) acquired through videos and quizzes to real-world case analyses and derive evidence-based conclusions.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
